message.content: {"id": "BUG19933", "title": "Emacs keybinding service always clears status line", "description": "When running with Emacs keybindings, any action that writes to the status line will have the status line message cleared by AcceleratorScope.resetMode. However, the action could have written to the status line. Currently, we do not have the necessary API to retrieve the message in the status line, so it is not possible to solve the problem in general. Nevertheless, the problem can be solved for some cases by not clearing the status line when running in the default mode.", "OB": "When a mode is entered, the key sequence that started the mode is written to the status line.", "EB": "Currently, there is no proposed solution for this bug.", "SR": "The bug occurs in Build 20020611."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '19933', 'title': 'Bug 19933Emacs: keybinding service always clears status line', 'description': 'Bug 19933Emacs: keybinding service always clears status line However, the action could havewritten to the status line.We currently do not have the API necessary to get the message in the statusline, so it is not possible to solve the problem in general. The problem can besolved for some cases by not clearing the status line when running in thedefault mode. ', 'OB': 'Build 20020611When running in with Emacs keybindings, any action that writes to the statusline will have the status line message cleared by AcceleratorScope.resetMode.When a mode is entered, the keysequence that started the mode is written to thestatus line. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'Build 20020611When running in with Emacs keybindings, any action that writes to the statusline will have the status line message cleared by AcceleratorScope.resetMode.When a mode is entered, the keysequence that started the mode is written to thestatus line. '}
